p: Comparison of hospitalized patients during the 2011 and 2014 epidemics showed higher percentage of patients had co-infection (10.1% vs. 4.2%, p = 0.031), with diagnosis of acute pharyngitis/PCF (63.9% vs. 38.6%, p = 0.031), and presented the symptoms of fever (100.0% vs. 88.9%), injected throat (96.2% vs. 83.1%), cough (88.6% vs. 79.9%) and rhinorrhea (83.5% vs. 59.3%, all p < 0.05) during the epidemic 2014. However, higher proportion of patients were hospitalized with the diagnosis of pneumonia in the 2011 epidemic than in the 2014 epidemic (10.6% vs. 5.1% p = 0.006).
